content:
If your machine is running an Intel graphics card, we recommend running the latest graphics drivers. These drivers, developed and approved by Intel, are distributed using the x-updates PPA (personal package archive). By default, this PPA is not added to the Ubuntu 12.04 repository list. 

To add the x-updates PPA to the Ubuntu 12.04 repository list, do the following:

[olist]      [*]Open [b]Ubuntu Software Center[/b].[/*]      [*]From the top-level menu, select [b]Edit [/b]| [b]Software Sources ... [/b].[/*]      [*]Select the [b]Other Software [/b]tab.[/*]      [*]Click the [b]Add ... [/b]button.[/*]      [*]Enter the following: deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/ubuntu-x-swat/x-updates/ubuntu precise main[/*]      [*]Click the [b]+Add Source[/b] button.[/*]      [*]Provide your user password when requested.[/*]      [*]Click the [b]Close [/b]button.[/*]      [*]Open [b]Update Manager[/b] (click the Unity icon on the launch bar and enter "update manager") and click the [b]Check [/b]button to refresh the package cache.[/*]  [/olist]

For more information related to video drivers, see [url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Valve]https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Valve[/url].
title: Adding a PPA Repository for the Latest Intel Drivers
